Where to start

When I got the assignment I wasn’t sure what to do. I figured I better ask someone for some advice. I decided that I should try asking my tutor for some advice first. My tutor told me to make sure I read and reread the assignment instructions. She also told me to start by looking at my own course notes and the module booklist.

Hi Lisa,
I am having trouble making a start on the assignment, I know I need to read and reread the assignment instructions but I am not sure where to go from there. Could you give me some pointers?

Hello,
Reading and rereading the assignment instructions is the right place to start. Make sure you are clear about what the task is asking you to do. Then look at what readings the assignment documents is directing you to. You will not to locate and read those sources to start with. You should also read back over your own notes along with the learning materials. Then you need to make your plan for the assignment.
Kind regards, Lisa.

If you are uncertain about your assignment ask your lecturer to clarify it

Get involved in any informal communication (email lists, discussion forums, Twitter, Facebook etc.) that your class may be using

Some lecturers are contactable by phone/email or through the VLE

Make sure you fully understand what you are being asked to do in the assignment.

Identify assignment main topic via the “keywords”

Start to think about potential places to look for information

Look back over any class material that your tutor may have provided i.e. course notes (in either digital or hard copy format)

Consult any material puts up on the college VLE (Virtual Learning Environment)

Most importantly review the notes you have taken while reading course materials and/or in lectures/tutorials, in order to help you identify key areas to concentrate on in your assignment.

Hi Eamon, Jennifer & Ann,
How would Wednesday evening at 8pm be for a Skype call be? It would be great to see if we all have the same interpretation of what the assignment instructions are asking us to do.

Hey there,
Wednesday at 8 suits me. I definitely have some things I want to ask your opinion about.
Eamon

Get involved in any informal communication (email lists, discussion forums, Twitter, Facebook etc.) that your class may be using

Set up a study group with whom to have such discussions
